overview: GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com now shows tool call details, supports exporting chats to JSON or Markdown, and improves repository attachment search and recommendations.

detailed_explanation.title: Tool call visibility
bullets: Copilot Chat responses now include clearer tool call details so you can track what’s happening in real time.
The stated benefits are understanding steps taken, course-correcting when something fails, and seeing references produced by each tool call.

detailed_explanation.title: Export chats
bullets: You can export a conversation for later reference.
Export flow: select a chat → open the “Manage chat” menu → choose Export → pick JSON or Markdown.

detailed_explanation.title: Repository attachments
bullets: Repository attachment UX has been improved so you can find the right repository faster.
Search now shows better repository recommendations.

detailed_explanation.title: Feedback channel
bullets: The article links to GitHub Community to discuss these Copilot Chat improvements.
Rollout timing and availability constraints are Not stated in the article.

key_changes: Copilot Chat on github.com now displays tool call details during responses.
Chats can be exported to JSON or Markdown from the chat management menu.
Repository attachment search and recommendations have been improved.
impact: Users can better understand and debug Copilot’s behavior by seeing tool call steps and references.
Teams can archive or share Copilot chats (as JSON/Markdown) for documentation or follow-up.
Attaching the correct repository to a chat should be faster due to improved recommendations.
caveats: Any limitations on which chats can be exported, export size, or retention are Not stated in the article.
Precise rollout scope (accounts, plans, regions) is Not stated in the article.
insights: Emphasizing tool call visibility suggests GitHub is prioritizing transparency and controllability for Copilot’s agent-like behavior on the web.
Providing exports in both JSON and Markdown indicates intent to support both machine processing and human-readable sharing.
